page.title: 09Tan-y-Groes/Sarnau, Ecology
page.content: The area has a large variety of{birds {feeding and nesting.}Buzzards and other birds of prey, crows and magpies are fairly common. Pigeons, starlings and sparrows{feed on the cereal}and other crops, and there are many different kinds of tit and finch in the hedgerows, including blue tit, chaffinch and goldfinch, as well as wagtails. Robins and wrens are seen frequently. Seagulls come to feed on crops and freshly ploughed land, from the coast a few miles away. Many kinds of snail and large slugs feed on the lush vegetation, and foxes, rabbits, squirrels and hares are also seen. Spiders, grasshoppers and crickets and other insects are plentiful. Frogs and toads are found in damper spots.
